XPSPL_AUTOLOADER¶

Autoloader

$class¶

$class()

milliseconds¶

milliseconds()

Returns the current time since epox in milliseconds.

Return type:integer

microseconds¶

microseconds()

Returns the current time since epox in microseonds.

Return type:integer

signal_exceptions¶

signal_exceptions($exception)¶

Transforms PHP exceptions into a signal.

The signal fired is XPSPLprocessorSignal::GLOBAL_EXCEPTION

Parameters:$exception (object) – Exception
Return type:void

signal_errors¶

signal_errors($errno, $errstr, $errfile, $errline)¶

Transforms PHP errors into a signal.

The signal fired is XPSPLprocessorSignal::GLOBAL_ERROR

Parameters:
  • $errno (int) –
  • $errstr (string) –
  • $errfile (string) –
  • $errline (int) –
Return type:

void

bin_search¶

bin_search($needle, $haystack[, $compare = false])¶

Performs a binary search for the given node returning the index.

Logic:

0 - Match > 0 - Move backwards < 0 - Move forwards

Parameters:
  • $needle (mixed) – Needle
  • $haystack (array) – Hackstack
  • $compare (closure) – Comparison function
Return type:

null|integer index, null locate failure

$node¶

$node()

get_class_name¶

get_class_name([$object = false])¶

Returns the name of a class using get_class with the namespaces stripped. This will not work inside a class scope as get_class() a workaround for that is using get_class_name(get_class());

Parameters:$object (object|string) – Object or Class Name to retrieve name
Return type:string Name of class with namespaces stripped
